entries.title: Qatar World Cup: Accommodation worries for football fans
entries.description: Organisers of the football tournament are facing criticism over a lack of affordable accommodation.

entries.title: Your pictures on the theme of 'the visitor'
entries.description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

entries.title: Scotland 2-1 Republic of Ireland: Perfect day for bleary-eyed goalkeeper Craig Gordon
entries.description: Adrenaline gets Craig Gordon through Scotland's 2-1 Nations League win over Republic of Ireland, he says, after the goalkeeper's sleepless night due to the birth of his son.

entries.title: Swapping Hong Kong for Crewe: 'We won't go back'
entries.description: The BBC has followed families who have moved from Hong Kong to the UK, to see if life is everything they hoped for.

entries.title: New prosthetic arm surfing aid tested in Bristol
entries.description: It is being trialled to help people with prosthetic arms enjoy sports such as surfing and yoga.

entries.title: ‘We demand wages for housework’
entries.description: In the 1970s, an international campaign demanded that governments recognise the value of unpaid work done in the home, primarily by women.

entries.title: The Mumbai B-boy taking India to the breakdance world championship
entries.description: Eshwar Tiwari began breaking 10 years ago for fun. He'll soon represent India at a world tournament.

entries.title: Scotland 2-1 Republic of Ireland: Ryan Christie's late penalty gives hosts crucial win
entries.description: Scotland need a point away to Ukraine on Tuesday to win Nations League Group B1 after a dogged comeback victory over the Republic of Ireland at Hampden.

entries.title: St Helens 'greatest Super League team' after record fourth straight Grand Final win - Woolf
entries.description: Coach Kristian Woolf believes St Helens' fourth straight Grand Final win 'closes the debate on the best team in the Super League era'.

entries.title: Nations League: Wales target win over Poland in Cardiff to stay in top flight
entries.description: A depleted Wales must beat Poland in Cardiff on Sunday to avoid relegation from the top tier of the Nations League.

entries.title: Storm Ian delays launch of Nasa's Artemis I Moon rocket
entries.description: The launch of the American space agency's big new Moon rocket is being delayed for the third time.

entries.title: Super League Grand Final: St Helens 24-12 Leeds Rhinos - Record-breaking Saints win fourth straight title
entries.description: St Helens win a record-breaking fourth consecutive Super League Grand Final and end Kristian Woolf's tenure by beating Leeds Rhinos.

entries.title: Great Britain's Mark Swan and Rebecca Bedford win European Para-powerlifting golds
entries.description: Mark Swan and Rebecca Bedford become European champions at the European Open Para-powerlifting Championships in Tbilisi, Georgia.

entries.title: England v India: Controversial run out secures 3-0 series whitewash for visitors
entries.description: Was India's match-winning dismissal of England's Charlie Dean really controversial, or just part of the game?

entries.title: Fi Glover and Jane Garvey to leave BBC for Times Radio
entries.description: The hosts of the hit Fortunately podcast will host a new weekday afternoon programme and a podcast.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Hundreds arrested as Russian draft protests continue
entries.description: Over 700 people were arrested at protests across the country on Saturday, rights groups said.

entries.title: Northern Ireland 2-1 Kosovo: Josh Magennis scores late winner in Nations League
entries.description: Josh Magennis heads home an injury-time winner as Northern Ireland came from behind to beat Kosovo at Windsor Park.

entries.title: England v India: Deepti Sharma dismisses Charlie Dean with 'Mankad' dismissal
entries.description: Watch Deepti Sharma's controversial 'Mankad' dismissal of Charlie Dean as India complete a 3-0 series whitewash over England.

entries.title: Beth Mead: Arsenal forward says record WSL crowd is 'still just the beginning'
entries.description: A record Women's Super League crowd is "still just the beginning" for women's football, says Arsenal forward Beth Mead.

entries.title: Laver Cup: Cameron Norrie loses as Team World level with Team Europe
entries.description: Cameron Norrie is beaten as Team World pull level with Team Europe, with Roger Federer cheering on his fellow Europeans the day after his retirement.

entries.title: England v India: Lord's finale ends with controversial run out as tourists claim series win
entries.description: India complete a 3-0 series whitewash over England in the third and final one-day international after a controversial dismissal by Deepti Sharma.

entries.title: Queen Elizabeth II: Picture of chapel ledger stone released
entries.description: The stone is engraved in memory of the Queen, her parents, and her late husband, the Duke of Edinburgh.

entries.title: Captured Briton Paul Urey's family raise repatriation funds
entries.description: Paul Urey, 45, died in July after being detained by pro-Russian separatists at a checkpoint.

entries.title: Pharoah Sanders: Jazz legend dies aged 81
entries.description: Sanders was known for his expressive style and played with some of the great names in jazz.

entries.title: Dmitry Bulgakov: Putin fires deputy defence chief amid supply failures
entries.description: Analysts have cited supply chains as a reason why Russia's invasion of Ukraine has faltered.

entries.title: World Rowing Championships: GB win four golds on penultimate day
entries.description: Great Britain win four golds medals and seven in total on the penultimate day at the 2022 World Rowing Championships in Racice, Czech Republic.

entries.title: Starmer's task is to soothe nerves and grow the economy
entries.description: Laura Kuenssberg on why her guest this Sunday faces a whole new set of political and economic challenges.

entries.title: WSL: Arsenal 4-0 Tottenham highlights as Vivianne Miedema scores twice
entries.description: Watch highlights as Arsenal thrash Tottenham 4-0 in the north London derby in front of a record WSL crowd of 47,367 at Emirates Stadium.

entries.title: Arsenal 4-0 Tottenham: Gunners cruise to victory in front of record crowd
entries.description: Vivianne Miedema scores twice as Arsenal cruise to a north London derby victory against Tottenham in front of a record crowd at Emirates Stadium.

entries.title: Sultan of Brunei pins RAF wings on son at Brize Norton
entries.description: The RAF said it was honoured to host the Sultan as reviewing officer for the presentation.

entries.title: Iran protests: Raisi to 'deal decisively' with widespread unrest
entries.description: Ebrahim Raisi pledges to "deal decisively" after an eighth straight night of protests across Iran.

entries.title: Road World Championships: Annemiek van Vleuten claims win despite fractured elbow
entries.description: Annemiek van Vleuten rides through the pain of a fractured elbow to win the women's road race at the Road World Championships in Australia.

entries.title: England v India, third ODI: Cross removes Verma and Bhatia
entries.description: England bowler Kate Cross removes Shafali Verma and Yastika Bhatia for ducks and Harmanpreet Kaur for four to leave India 17-3 in the third ODI at Lord's.

entries.title: Presidents Cup: International captain Trevor Immelman laughs at Greg Norman's well wishes against US
entries.description: Trevor Immelman is amused by the well wishes sent to his International Presidents Cup team on Friday by LIV Golf commissioner Greg Norman.

entries.title: Emma Raducanu retires from Korea Open semi-final against Jelena Ostapenko with injury
entries.description: Emma Raducanu retires with a glute injury in semi-finals of Korea Open, conceding to top seed Jelena Ostapenko.

entries.title: Louise Fletcher: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest's Nurse Ratched dies aged 88
entries.description: Fletcher won an Oscar for her memorable portrayal of the film's villainous Nurse Ratched.

entries.title: Kwasi Kwarteng's tax cuts benefit top 1%, Labour says
entries.description: The government is taking a dangerous gamble, Angela Rayner says, but ministers argue tax cuts will get the economy growing.

entries.title: Leicester disorder: Five more men charged by police
entries.description: It brings the total charged to eight, with 47 arrested, following recent disorder in the city.

entries.title: Road World Championships: Injured Annemiek van Vleuten wins in 'stunning' finale
entries.description: Dutchwoman Annemiek van Vleuten wins women's road race gold despite a fractured elbow at the Road World Championships in Australia.

entries.title: Londoner reels in fish-catching record
entries.description: Joe Murfitt has caught a fish in every one of the capital's districts and the City of London.

entries.title: Bellator Dublin talking points: Five things we learned
entries.description: Benson Henderson shows his class, Queally gives Dublin another walkout to remember and Manhoef's career ends in defeat - BBC Sport looks at five things we learned from Bellator Dublin.

entries.title: Roger Federer hopes to 'party again together' with fans after retirement
entries.description: Swiss legend Roger Federer plans to say 'thank you' to his legions of fans across the world after retiring from professional tennis.

entries.title: Royal raid: The curious case of the Irish Crown Jewels
entries.description: A scandalous heist at Dublin Castle made international headlines and remains unsolved to this day.

entries.title: Max Whitlock: Olympic champion felt like 'complete failure' after retirement thoughts
entries.description: Three-time Olympic gold medallist Max Whitlock "felt like a complete failure" when he contemplated stepping away from the sport after the Tokyo Games.

entries.title: Chris Mason: Tax cuts signal radical shift in No 10 policy
entries.description: For something that wasn't even technically a Budget, it was one heck of a statement of intent.

entries.title: EU 'must take seriously' Putin nuclear threats - Borrell
entries.description: EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell told the BBC a dangerous moment had been reached in the Ukraine war.

entries.title: The surprising violence in multicultural Leicester
entries.description: Recent unrest between Hindu and Muslim men has raised difficult questions for the city.

entries.title: Home Secretary Suella Braverman tells police to stop symbolic gestures
entries.description: The new home secretary writes to police chiefs saying trust has been shattered and calling for change.

entries.title: Jeremy Corbyn: Tory economic plan is irresponsible
entries.description: The former Labour leader says his borrowing would have been for investment not "to pay bankers' bonuses".

entries.title: Now is the time for Starmer to be bold, says union leader
entries.description: Unite's general secretary predicts senior Labour MPs will soon return to picket lines.

entries.title: Elton John honoured after White House performance
entries.description: US President Joe Biden surprised Sir Elton John by giving him a medal for his contribution to music.

entries.title: Testing the new iPhone: From battery to always-on screen
entries.description: The BBC's Technology Editor, Zoe Kleinman, has been testing out the latest Apple smartphone.

entries.title: Strictly Come Dancing; How are this year's newly-paired couples feeling?
entries.description: The widely watched dancing competition has paired the celebrities, including comedian Ellie Taylor and actor Will Mellor, with their dancing professionals.

entries.title: Would more UK gas actually bring down prices?
entries.description: The government is committed to extracting more oil and gas in the North Sea.

entries.title: Can the NHS learn from Germany’s health system?
entries.description: Despite public support for the NHS, satisfaction levels have fallen, raising thoughts of reform.

entries.title: Analysis: Labour looks more united as conference starts
entries.description: Divisions haven't gone away but Labour is coalescing in opposition to Tory policies, says the BBC's Iain Watson.

entries.title: Kwarteng's mini-budget: Shock-and-awe tactics from an unapologetic chancellor
entries.description: The sheer daring nature of the Kwasi Kwarteng's announcement caused shockwaves, says Newsnight's Nicholas Watt.

entries.title: Presidents Cup: Team USA extend lead over International team after day two
entries.description: The United States are on course to maintain their Presidents Cup dominance as they extend their lead over the International team to 8-2 after day two.

entries.title: Roger Federer: 20-time Grand Slam champion retires after Laver Cup loss
entries.description: Roger Federer brings the curtain down on his illustrious career by teaming up with fellow great Rafael Nadal on an emotional night in London.

entries.title: Jhulan Goswami: The highest wicket-taker in women's ODI history to retire
entries.description: On Saturday, one of India's best female cricketers is set to play her last international game.

entries.title: Max Whitlock: Olympic champion felt like 'complete failure' after retirement thoughts
entries.description: Three-time Olympic gold medallist Max Whitlock "felt like a complete failure" when he contemplated stepping away from the sport after the Tokyo Games.
